verse:
<sub><small>25</small></sub> Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.
<sub><small>26</small></sub> My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.

<sub><small>10</small></sub> But he knows the way that I take; when he has tested me, I will come forth as gold.
<sub><small>11</small></sub> My feet have closely followed his steps; I have kept to his way without turning aside.

<sub><small>8</small></sub> For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, declares the Lord. <sub><small>9</small></sub> As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts.
<sub><small>9</small></sub> Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.

<sub><small>14</small></sub> For Christâ€™s love compels us, because we are convinced that one died for all, and therefore all died. <sub><small>15</small></sub> And he died for all, that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for him who died for them and was raised again.
<sub><small>16</small></sub> This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.

<sub><small>20</small></sub> I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
